race.name: Little Apple 100
race.tagline: Illinois State Championship 100-mile gravel through farmland.

climate.description: Variable conditions with heat, wind, and humidity possible.

terrain.surface: Farmland and rolling gravel roads. Moderate elevation with 100-mile distance challenge.

gravel_god_rating.score_note: Illinois State Championship. 100 miles is significant but flat farmland terrain and regional field.

biased_opinion.summary: Little Apple 100 is Illinois' State Championship gravel race—a 100-mile challenge through northern Illinois farmland. The state championship status and century distance elevate it above typical regional events, but it's still flat farmland terrain with regional field depth. Manhattan is a small town near Chicago with basic amenities. It's well-organized for a state championship with moderate field size.
biased_opinion.bottom_line: A solid Illinois State Championship gravel race with 100-mile distance challenge. Worth it for Illinois cyclists seeking state championship status. Not a destination race for out-of-state travelers, but a good state-level century event.

final_verdict.one_liner: Illinois State Championship 100-mile gravel through flat farmland.
final_verdict.should_you_race: If you're in Illinois and want state championship status—yes, it's a well-organized century event. If you're from out of state—there are more prestigious events elsewhere.
final_verdict.alternatives: For better Midwest events: Gravel Worlds, Almanzo 100, Dirty Kanza. For similar state championships: other state championship events.

logistics.lodging_strategy: Manhattan has basic lodging. Chicago suburbs have more options.
logistics.food: Small town with basic dining. Stock nutrition for 100 miles.

course_description.character: Flat to rolling farmland gravel for 100 miles.
course_description.signature_challenge: 100-mile distance through Illinois farmland with heat, wind, and humidity.

non_negotiables.why: 100 miles requires extensive endurance base and long-distance preparation.
Illinois summer means heat and humidity are real concerns.
Illinois farmland means significant wind exposure.

topics.heat: Racing in Illinois heat and humidity

marketplace_variables.race_hook: 100 miles of Illinois State Championship farmland gravel.
marketplace_variables.race_hook_detail: State championship century event near Chicago.

logistics.explanation: 525 South State Street provides clear start location with 8:00 AM timing and neutral roll-out preventing start crashes. dfriestedt warns riders to maintain exit strategies: "You and only you are responsible for your front wheel. If you overlap wheels in rough gravel you are asking for trouble." Course management includes on-course water stations at mile 45.

length.explanation: 100 miles creates psychological warfare as much as physical suffering. One elite rider popped off the lead group at mile 11: "I spent the next 5 miles trying to convince myself why I love gravel, and to just go slow, it doesn't matter." Partnership racing emerges when distance demands cooperation over pure competition. Longer than Belgian Waffle Ride San Diego.

technicality.explanation: Course features 88% gravel with notorious "Devil's Gravel" sections creating white knuckle moments. Coach_Theia advises staying "on the far right or far left sides, in the smooth section and close to the grass" to avoid the rough center. Multiple corner crashes occurred in loose conditions, but bike handling skills matter less than positioning. Less technical than The Mid South.

elevation.explanation: 3000 feet over 100 miles creates sustained effort through farm areas of southern Chicago region. Ironman Chris describes "five miles long" climbing sections with headwinds that separate groups early. The challenge comes from accumulated fatigue rather than steep technical gradients requiring specialized climbing skills. Less climbing than The Mid South.

climate.explanation: Historical weather data shows average highs of 82°F and lows of 65°F, with a 52% chance of rain on any given day. Weather amplifies crash risks on rough gravel surfaces. Multiple riders went down in corners, with one crash victim noting "Devil's gravel lived up to its name. I think my brain is still tired from staring at the ground trying to find a good-enough line." Conditions vary year to year but demand constant attention. More weather exposure than Belgian Waffle Ride San Diego.

altitude.explanation: Manhattan, Illinois sits near sea level in the Great Plains. Zero altitude considerations affect performance or acclimatization while distance and technical gravel surfaces create the primary physiological and mental challenges. Lower altitude than Gravel Worlds — no thin-air concerns.

adventure.explanation: Farm areas of southern Chicago provide rural backdrop without wilderness isolation. Elite 50K winner noted gravel conditions vary dramatically: "I promise there are so many different types of gravel and today was just a lot rougher than usual." Adventure comes from technical challenge rather than remote exploration.

prestige.explanation: Illinois State Championships designation attracts competitive teams like Hardcore Cycling Club. Elite riders face internal battles with one describing mile 11 crisis: "Dark thoughts are evil things. They suck the life from your legs and squeeze the blood from your heart until you utter the words, 'I quit.'" Regional championship creates meaningful competitive pressure.

race_quality.explanation: Organized support includes mid-course water stations and neutral roll-out preventing start incidents. Elite riders can recover from early struggles through strategic partnerships, with one duo agreeing to "team time trial the shit out of this fu*king race" after being dropped. Consistent infrastructure supports varied racing strategies.

experience.explanation: State championship creates psychological pressure beyond typical gravel events. One elite rider nearly quit early but found redemption through partnership: "we agree to team time trial the shit out of this fu*king race." Mental resilience becomes as important as physical preparation.

community.explanation: Local residents provide on-course support with "the cutest little cheer leaders" offering cold water at mile 45. Finish line sportsmanship emerges when competitive riders "literally tried to tie across the finish line" after working together, declaring "there's no way we are sprinting this out." Post-crash care shows riders watching out for each other.

field_depth.explanation: 64 starters in documented years with 7 DNFs showing competitive attrition rates. Matt Zalewski broke away solo for 20 miles to win the 150km open race, while multiple distance options scatter talent across categories. Regional state championship draws serious racers but lacks national-level depth. Less competitive depth than Almanzo 100. As Course profile vs. reality puts it: "Never … and I mean NEVER … in my experience has a race profile so understated the difficulty of a course"

value.explanation: Steve earns recognition as "Nicest USAC official, 2nd only to his wife Brenda" according to podium finishers. Community investment includes free cold water stations and enthusiastic spectator support. Pre-race atmosphere features "Team Dog or Team Cat" sticker selection adding personality to competitive proceedings.

expenses.explanation: Registration runs $80-120. Manhattan, Illinois location means accessible small-town pricing without destination cycling premiums. Shady tree parking and straightforward logistics at 525 South State Street suggest reasonable overhead costs. Travel expenses depend on distance from central Illinois rather than expensive cycling resort destinations. Similar expense level to Belgian Waffle Ride San Diego.

key_takeaways: Historical Note: The search results show earlier iterations of this race—one dated August 13, 2023, and another dated August 3-4, 2024—suggestin

primary.name: Specialized Pathfinder Pro
primary.why: Fast center, grippy edges. The modern all-rounder benchmark.

front_rear_split.rationale: Faster front for reduced rolling resistance on straights, grippier rear for traction on loose climbs and corners

videos.title: Little Apple Gravel Race 100k Open 2025 - Manhattan Illinois
videos.description:
Join me on the rugged, dusty gravel roads just 50 miles southwest of Chicago for the thrilling Little Apple Gravel Race, a fast-growing event that's capturing the hearts of cyclists!  This year’s race offered something for everyone, with USAC-licensed categories (50km and 100km) and the popular Open categories (50km, 100km, and 150km). 
In this video, I tackle the challenging 100km (63-mile) Open category, battling tough terrain and epic competition. Watch the action, feel the grind, and discover why this gravel race is a must for cycling enthusiasts! Don’t forget to like, comment, and subscribe for more biking adventures!  

00:00 - Intro
03:05 - Bridge/Start
11:09 - Close The Gap
16:01 - The Lead Group
22:30 - The Farm
29:44 - Getting Dropped
36:03 - The Sprint

My fueling strategy for 63 mile race (including few sips from handed water at rest stops)
1st  24oz bottle - 100 carbs (400 calories) of Skratch high carb drink mix -
 https://amzn.to/4lgJjgc
2nd 24oz bottle - Endurolytes Fizz from Hammer Nutrition (15% discount through the link if you are new to Hammer Nutrition)
1 Hammer gel for each hour of riding (Nocciola is my favorite :-))
https://www.hammernutrition.com/SPOKEDTRAILS03633
24oz insulated bottle - https://amzn.to/40VhjYm


I might earn a small fee if you make a purchase through these links at no cost to you.
videos.curation_reason: Most recent first-person race recap from 2025 with good production quality and detailed race experience.

videos.title: Little Apple Gravel Race | Manhattan IL
videos.description:
The first Illinois State Championship Gravel Race!

My first Gran Fondo gravel bike race! 61 miles of rough gravel and some smaller roads and you guessed it, lots of corn! Location - Manhattan Illinois (40 mins from Chicago).

This gravel race is hosted by South Chicago Wheelman.

The Ride - https://strava.app.link/qmHaHYiuOib

videos.title: 2019.08.11 Little Apple 100k
videos.description:
This is a gravel race in Manhattan Illinois, beautifully organized by the South Chicago Wheelmen. The race is 2 laps of a 50k course thru farm roads, with a small bit of pavement, mostly 'normal' gravel, and one or two sections of 'pretty loose'. My tires were 40mm G-One Speed at probably like 50 PSI. I'd do the same thing next time - this race isn't one I could ride 28mm. It rained just before the race, but the sun came out as we started. Steady wind from the South.

Video starts as we roll thru the finish line with 50k done and 50k to go. The group is reduced to about 30 here. 

56:06 - Starts to get selective. Tailwind section here.
57:35 - Crosswind left-to-right. Group can smell the finish, it's time to go hard.
59:52 - This is such a good spot to rest up for a moment. Riders in the left lane are shelter from the wind, plus rider in front.
1:02:15 - This is pretty much the group that made it to the finish together.
1:07:33 - Left turn onto probably the loosest section here. You can see that my soft-over-hard skills are totally absent here. Wind is right to left, once we make the turn. Don't worry, I'm still getting quite a bit of shelter even one lane over :)
1:27:03 - This is where you see Sean's race-winning sprint
videos.curation_reason: Comprehensive full-length race experience with detailed course conditions and technical insights in description.
